1.0.description: Understand what IPFS is and why IPFS was started

subgoals.description: Understand what is a peer to peer(p2p) network
Know the difference between centralised, decentralised, and distributed networks
Trade offs between centralised services & p2p systems
Understand how IPFS is trying to design systems that are future-proof

1.1.description: Understand Content Addressing, CIDs, and what advantages they present over location-based addressing

subgoals.description: Be able to describe why content in IPFS is immutable
Know the difference between location addressing vs content addressing
Fundamentally know what a CID is and its variations
Understand that data on IPFS is pinned to be made available to the network

1.4.description: Be able to explain the basics of data transfer in IPFS

subgoals.description: Learn what is IPFS's message-oriented protocol to exchange data
Know what are the different message types and their order of operations
Understand what is the session and the ledger in the context of Bitswap
Explain the different components of Bitswap at a high level
Discover what advantages Graphsync has over Bitswap

1.6.description: Be able to explain the basics of UnixFS

subgoals.description: Understand what is UnixFS and what problem it solves
Learn how files with more than a single block are labeled
Go over the protobuf format, and its main field
